meanings.definition: The act of intervening or coming between
meanings.sent1: During the argument, his calm supervention helped resolve the conflict.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's supervention prevented the students from fighting.
meanings.sent3: The supervention of the mediator brought peace to the situation.
meanings.sent4: Her timely supervention in the dispute saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The supervention of the referee ensured a fair game for all.

meanings.definition: An event or circumstance that occurs as a result of something else happening
meanings.sent1: The power outage was a direct supervention of the storm.
meanings.sent2: The celebration was a joyful supervention after months of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected supervention of a parade made the traffic worse.
meanings.sent4: The sudden supervention of rain canceled the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The supervention of a new law changed the way businesses operated.

meanings.definition: The act of superseding or taking the place of something else
meanings.sent1: The supervention of technology replaced the need for manual labor.
meanings.sent2: His promotion was a clear supervention of the previous manager.
meanings.sent3: The robot's supervention in the assembly line increased efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The supervention of online shopping impacted traditional retail stores.
meanings.sent5: The supervention of digital cameras made film cameras obsolete.
